DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Collaborative Staging Factor Twenty-four Site Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies additional information needed to generate stage, or prognostic factors that have an effect on stage of survival.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Collaborative Staging Factor Twenty-four Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Site-specific information needed to derive TNM or AJCC stage, or to code prognostic factors that have an effect on stage or survival.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: A coding system for staging of cancer bringing together the principles of Summary Stage, the TNM categories and stage groupings, and the SEER Extent of Disease (EOD) coding structure, creating a carefully selected set of data items that describe how far a cancer has spread at the time of diagnosis. The Collaborative Staging System uses a modified EOD coding system, a five-field, 10 digit system: tumor size (3 digits), extension of the primary tumor (2 digits), regional lymph node involvement (highest specific lymph node chain involved by tumor) (1 digit), the number of pathologically reviewed regional lymph nodes that are positive (2 digits), and the number of pathologically examined regional lymph nodes (2 digits).:Factor; anything that contributes causally to a result.:A number with no fractional part.::24:Position in relation to the surroundings.

Concepts.definition: A coding system for staging of cancer bringing together the principles of Summary Stage, the TNM categories and stage groupings, and the SEER Extent of Disease (EOD) coding structure, creating a carefully selected set of data items that describe how far a cancer has spread at the time of diagnosis. The Collaborative Staging System uses a modified EOD coding system, a five-field, 10 digit system: tumor size (3 digits), extension of the primary tumor (2 digits), regional lymph node involvement (highest specific lymph node chain involved by tumor) (1 digit), the number of pathologically reviewed regional lymph nodes that are positive (2 digits), and the number of pathologically examined regional lymph nodes (2 digits).
Anything that contributes causally to a result.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

The Collaborative Staging System uses a modified EOD coding system, a five-field, 10 digit system: tumor size (3 digits), extension of the primary tumor (2 digits), regional lymph node involvement (highest specific lymph node chain involved by tumor) (1 digit), the number of pathologically reviewed regional lymph nodes that are positive (2 digits), and the number of pathologically examined regional lymph nodes (2 digits).

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: Rationale
ReferenceDocuments.description: Site-specific factors are used to record additional staging information needed by Collaborative Staging to derive TNM and/or SEER Summary Stage codes for particular site-histology schema.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Collaborative Stage (CS) Coding
ReferenceDocuments.description: The information recorded in CS Site-Specific Factor 24 differs for each anatomic site. See the most current verison of the Collaborative Staging Data Collection System for rules and site-specific codes and coding structures.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 16, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)

DataElement.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
